Selected Answer: A
Permissions granted by the Endpoint Security Manager role:
Remote tasks - Rotate BitLockerKeys (Preview)
 Rotate FileVault key
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/endpoint-security#permissions-granted-by-the-endpoint-security-manager-role

Selected Answer: B
The Endpoint Security Manager role in Microsoft Intune provides permissions to manage security policies and settings, but it does not grant permissions specifically to rotate BitLocker recovery keys.

To ensure User1 can rotate BitLocker recovery keys, they need to be assigned a role with the appropriate permissions. The "Help Desk Administrator" role in Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure AD) or a custom role in Intune with the "Rotate BitLocker Keys" permission would be more appropriate.

Provided answer seems to be incorrect here.
From https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-endpoint/configure-machines-security-baseline
"Ideally, devices onboarded to Defender for Endpoint are deployed both baselines: the Windows Intune security baseline to initially secure Windows and then the Defender for Endpoint security baseline layered on top to optimally configure the Defender for Endpoint security controls."
So correct answer is E.
